meanings.definition: A person who votes in an election.
meanings.sent1: The voter cast their ballot at the polling station.
meanings.sent2: Every voter plays a crucial role in shaping the future through elections.
meanings.sent3: The voter wore a sticker proudly proclaiming, 'I made my voice heard!'
meanings.sent4: She was a diligent voter, always making sure to research the candidates thoroughly.
meanings.sent5: The young voter felt empowered as they placed their vote for the first time.

meanings.definition: One who has the right to vote.
meanings.sent1: As a voter, he eagerly awaited election day to exercise his right.
meanings.sent2: The voters lined up early in the morning to participate in the democratic process.
meanings.sent3: The voter's ID card was their ticket to influencing government decisions.
meanings.sent4: She cherished her role as a voter, recognizing the importance of civic engagement.
meanings.sent5: The elderly voter reminisced about the voting rights struggles they had witnessed.
